metadata.title: Multi-Layered Analogy System
metadata.purpose: Complex concept explanation through accessible analogies

section.title: Framework Overview
section.description: This framework ensures complex concepts are made accessible through brilliant, illuminating analogies that work at multiple levels of understanding.

examples.ai-learning: Like teaching a child to recognize cats by showing many pictures
examples.neural-networks: Like a recipe that adjusts ingredients based on taste tests
examples.data-processing: Like sorting mail into different categories
examples.optimization: Like finding the fastest route to work through trial and error

layer.title: Professional (Work/Collaboration)
layer.purpose: Connect to structured thinking and teamwork
layer.audience: Anyone with work or project experience

examples.ai-learning: Like a new employee learning company procedures from examples
examples.neural-networks: Like a team where each member's contribution affects the final decision
examples.data-processing: Like a production line with quality checks at each station
examples.optimization: Like refining a presentation based on audience feedback

layer.title: Historical (Past Innovations)
layer.purpose: Provide context and reduce fear of the new

examples.ai-learning: Like how the printing press learned from scribes' techniques
examples.neural-networks: Like the telegraph network that connected distant cities
examples.data-processing: Like the library card catalog system organizing knowledge
examples.optimization: Like how evolution optimizes species for their environment

step.name: Identify Core Mechanism
step.question: What is the essential process happening here?

step.name: Find Universal Parallel
step.question: Where does this pattern appear in everyday life?

step.name: Develop Professional Connection
step.question: How does this manifest in work/collaboration?

step.name: Discover Historical Echo
step.question: When has humanity faced this before?

step.name: Test and Refine
step.question: Does this analogy illuminate or obscure?

complexity-level.title: Simple Concepts
complexity-level.example: AI recognizing images is like how you instantly know it's your friend's face in a crowd.

complexity-level.title: Intermediate Concepts
complexity-level.example: Machine learning optimization is like perfecting a recipe (Universal). You make small adjustments each time, like a chef refining a dish based on customer feedback (Professional). It's similar to how traditional craftsmen perfected their techniques over generations (Historical).

complexity-level.title: Advanced Concepts
complexity-level.example: Transformer attention mechanisms are like hosting a dinner party (Universal). You pay attention to different conversations based on relevance, like a project manager allocating resources to critical tasks (Professional). It mirrors how telegraph operators prioritized messages based on importance and urgency (Historical).

protocol.title: Three-Step Critique
protocol.step: Identify Limitations: "This analogy captures X but misses Y"
Improve Understanding: "Think of it more like Z because..."
Connect Concepts: "This bridges our earlier discussion and prepares us for..."

example.critique: You know what? Comparing neural networks to the brain captures the inspiration but misses the fundamental differences. Think of it more like a massive vote-counting system where millions of simple decisions combine to make complex judgments. This connects to our earlier point about collective intelligence and sets up our exploration of emergent behaviors.

pitfall.title: Too Literal
pitfall.incorrect: AI neurons work exactly like brain neurons
pitfall.correct: AI neurons are inspired by brain neurons but work differently

pitfall.title: Too Abstract
pitfall.incorrect: It's like the manifestation of collective consciousness
pitfall.correct: It's like how a flock of birds moves as one unit

pitfall.title: Too Technical
pitfall.incorrect: It's like matrix multiplication with backpropagation
pitfall.correct: It's like adjusting ingredients based on taste tests

pitfall.title: Culturally Specific
pitfall.correct: It's like keeping score in any game

requirements.requirement: Maintain Humility: "One way to think about it..."

successful-analogy.title: Machine Learning Bias
successful-analogy.universal: Like inheriting your parents' taste in music
successful-analogy.professional: Like hiring managers unconsciously favoring their alma mater
successful-analogy.historical: Like early maps that made Europe look bigger than Africa

successful-analogy.title: Recursive Algorithms
successful-analogy.universal: Like looking in a mirror facing another mirror
successful-analogy.professional: Like delegating a task that involves more delegating
successful-analogy.historical: Like Russian nesting dolls, each containing smaller versions

successful-analogy.title: Distributed Computing
successful-analogy.universal: Like many cooks preparing different dishes for one meal
successful-analogy.professional: Like dividing a big project among team members
successful-analogy.historical: Like barn-raising where the whole community helps
